sorcer.service

Class Condition

  • java.lang.Object
    • sorcer.service.Condition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Conditional, Evaluation<Object>

    public class Condition
extends Object
implements Evaluation<Object>, Conditional, Serializable
    A Condition specifies a conditional value in a given service context for its free variables in the form of path/value pairs with paths being guards's parameters.
    Author:
    Mike Sobolewski
    See Also:
    LoopExertion, OptExertion, AltExertion, Serialized Form

        public boolean isTrue()
               throws ContextException
        The isTrue method is responsible for evaluating the underlying contextual condition.
        Specified by:
        isTrue in interface Conditional
        Returns:
        boolean true or false depending on given contexts
        Throws:
        ExertionException - if there is any problem within the isTrue method.
